comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: LOC: note typo in transcription of airship name "Parseval" In this copy, Bain has redacted the source info, May & Co.'s postcard 300. The unredacted photo is reproduced by Flickr user DesertBlooms here: flic.kr/p/aLtzFD Part of postcard series elsewhere in Bain Collection of pre WWI British airplanes and airships. And here's some motion picture footage: www.britishpathe.com/video/airships-earliest-days-aka-air... Parseval was the name of the designer, and there were 22 such ships built. This one could be the PL-18 No. 4 en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Parseval_airships#PL_18_-_No.4

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The biplane at front right, No. 235 is identified as a BE.2a here: www.ukserials.com/serials-older-000.htm It is a Royal Aircraft Factory (Blériot Experimental) en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_Aircraft_Factory_B.E.2

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
artolog,

Thank you very much for such in depth digging about the airship and the accompanying plane - and for providing great citations. We'll add more identifying information when we update this record.
